content.question: Is there a force exerted by the magnet on the loop as the magnet falls through it? Why or why not?

choices.label: No. Because the loop is not magnetized, it will not be affected by the magnet.
No. Because the loop is not moving, there are no forces on it.
Yes. Because the magnetic field due to current in the loop exerts a force on the magnet, the magnet also exerts a force on the loop.
Yes. Because gravity acts on the loop, the magnet must exert a force on the loop to keep it at rest.

content.answer: Yes. Because the magnetic field due to current in the loop exerts a force on the magnet, the magnet also exerts a force on the loop.
